Questions.EnglishHTML: Pioneering for other companies, our company was the first in the world to succeed in demonstrating ocean current power generation.

Questions.JapaneseHTML: スプートニク１号は世界に先駆けて打ち上げられた人工衛星です。
Questions.EnglishHTML: Pioneering for the rest of the world, Sputnik was the first artificial satellite to be launched.

Name: を機(き)に
Meaning: Opportunity, Occasion
About: When used as a noun, 機(き) ‘opportunity’ indicates a time that is being used as suitable chance to do something. It is slightly formal and will usually be translated as ‘on the occasion of (A), (B)’. However, due to this grammar point being a construction of the adverbial particle を, 機(き), and the case-marking particle に, it is indicating that the speaker is actively making use of the opportunity of (A)’. Due to this, it can be understood as ‘taking advantage of (A), (B)’, or ‘taking advantage of the time of (A), (B)’ on many occasions. を機(き)に will directly follow nouns marking (A), before going on to explain how that (A) was utilized as an opportunity. を機(き)に tends to be used most frequently when (B) is an action that the speaker is choosing to take primarily with (A) as the enabling factor, or being a good excuse.

AboutExamples.JapaneseHTML: 妻の妊娠を機にタバコを止めることにした。
AboutExamples.EnglishHTML: Taking advantage of the time of my wife’s pregnancy, I have decided to quit smoking.

AboutExamples.JapaneseHTML: 車検を機に、新しい車を買うことにした。
AboutExamples.EnglishHTML: On the occasion of my car inspection, I have decided to buy a new car. (Due to being told that the current car is probably beyond repair)

AboutExamples.JapaneseHTML: 彼氏と別れたのを機に、新しいバッグを買った。
AboutExamples.EnglishHTML: Making the most of the breakup with my boyfriend, I bought a new bag. (In order to feel new and fresh)

AboutExamples.JapaneseHTML: ７年間使っていた携帯がとうとう壊れた。これを機に機種変更することにした。
AboutExamples.EnglishHTML: My cell phone, which I had been using for 7 years, finally broke. I decided to take this opportunity to change the model.

Questions.JapaneseHTML: 小説：「３ヶ月目にやっと病気が完治し、これを機に、入院後初めて退院することができた。」
Questions.EnglishHTML: Novel: 'In the third month, she was finally completely cured of her illness, and this opportunity allowed her to leave the hospital for the first time since hospitalization.'

Questions.JapaneseHTML: 伝記：「大学卒業を機に大阪へ移り、プログラミングの職を得ることができました。」
Questions.EnglishHTML: Biography: 'On the opportunity of graduation, I moved to Osaka and was able to land a programming job.'

Questions.JapaneseHTML: 演説：「今回の訪問を機に、より多くのアメリカ人が日本で働くことに興味を持つことを願っています。」
Questions.EnglishHTML: Speech: 'We hope that this visit will provide an opportunity for more Americans to be interested in working in Japan.'

Questions.JapaneseHTML: 小説：「結婚を機にたまひこは東京を離れ、千葉の町でゆずきとふたりの新生活を始じめた。」
Questions.EnglishHTML: Novel: 'On the opportunity of getting married, Tamahiko left Tokyo and started a new life with Yuzuki in the town of Chiba.'

Questions.JapaneseHTML: 伝記：「ひろしは５６歳の時故郷へ戻ったのを機に、両親の墓参りに行った。」
Questions.EnglishHTML: Biography: 'When Hiroshi returned to his hometown at the age of 56, he took the opportunity to visit his parent's graves.'

Name: こととて
Meaning: Due to, Since, On account of, Because
About: こととて is a combination of the noun こと 'thing', and the binding (adverbial) particle とて, which is used for presenting reasons. It will be translated as 'due to (A)', or 'because of (A)'. This is a fairly old-fashioned expression, and will almost exclusively be used in writing in modern Japanese. To use こととて, attach it to the end of a verb, or a noun followed by the case-marking particle の. こととて will primarily be used when asking for forgiveness for something. Due to this, when appearing after verbs, the verb will usually be in past tense, or have been negated with either ない or ぬ. This highlights something that was done and shouldn't have been, or wasn't done and should have been. In many cases, (A) will be something for which the negative result of (B) is obvious, or to be expected.

AboutExamples.JapaneseHTML: あの事件は２０年前に起こったこととて、世間からは忘れられているだろう。
AboutExamples.EnglishHTML: Due to that incident happening 20 years ago, it probably has been forgotten by the public.

AboutExamples.JapaneseHTML: 商品についてあまり知らぬこととて、お客様の信頼を失ってしまった。
AboutExamples.EnglishHTML: Due to me lacking knowledge about the product, I unfortunately lost credibility.

AboutExamples.JapaneseHTML: 新人のこととて、まだ分からないことがたくさんありますが、これからよろしくお願いいたします。
AboutExamples.EnglishHTML: Since I am still new, there are many things I don't know, but please take good care of me.

AboutExamples.JapaneseHTML: 突然のこととて、前の車を避けきれませんでした。
AboutExamples.EnglishHTML: Due to it being a sudden event, I was not able to avoid the car in front of me.

Questions.JapaneseHTML:
時代劇、Ａ：「あなたのお父さんによろしくお伝えください。」
Ｂ：「お父さんは遥か昔に亡くなりました。」
Ａ：「そうでしたか。知らぬこととて、失礼をお許しください。」
Questions.EnglishHTML:
A period drama, A: 'Please, send my greetings to your father.'
B: 'My father passed away long ago.'
A: 'Is that so? Please, forgive my rudeness due to my lack of knowledge.'

Questions.JapaneseHTML: 古い手紙：「取り込み中のこととてご迷惑をおかけしましたがなにとぞご寛容のほどお願い申し上げます。」
Questions.EnglishHTML: Old letter: 'I have caused you a lot of trouble due to being busy, but I would kindly ask for your understanding.'

Questions.JapaneseHTML: 「仕事になれぬこととて間違いをしてしまいました。申し訳ございません。」
Questions.EnglishHTML: 'I made a mistake due to not being accustomed to the work. For that I am awfully sorry.'

Questions.JapaneseHTML: 「田舎のこととて年齢や学年に関係なく生徒が勉強する教室が１教室だけしかなかった。」
Questions.EnglishHTML: Since it was the countryside, there was only one classroom where school children studied, regardless of their age or grade.

Questions.JapaneseHTML: 「子供がやったこととて、親としてお詫び申し上げます。」
Questions.EnglishHTML: 'Since my child did it, I would like to apologize as their parent.'
